comment: I took this class online, and everything came from the book, there are no lectures. She was usually pretty good about responding to emails. She is a tough grader so make sure to include your reasoning for your opinion. Also, she accepts late work. There were 7 quizzes and she dropped the lowest grade.
Shes okay I guess. You wont ever know why she took points off of your assignments, though.

Hard class. Makes test straight from the book so must be prepared to read a lot and remember little facts. Usually each test consists of 5 chapters which is around over 100 pages read. READ! You will not do well on her exams if you do not read. Curves exams from 5-7 points. Kinda funny and nice but overall find another professor.

Grading is subjective, be prepared to have no idea why you failed. Only talk in "sociology talk" and never have it explained to you. Memorize the textbook, otherwise you obviously didn't understand the content. Come out frustrated and confused. Pretty dissatisfied.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Participation matters--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: No exams. You are given 3 grades per week. One for a discussion post, one for participation (replying to a classmate), and the other is for a "quiz", but the quiz is answering another discussion-type question. Five-page research paper due at the end of the semester on a topic of your choice.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Prof. doesn't give clear feedback. She takes away points and tells the whole class to "speak in Sociology talk" but never once explained what she meant by that. No clear grade scale so never know where you stand. 5 DB/week plus quizzes, and exams. On positive side she is very organized with lessons and the two small books we used were useful.

I took intro to sociology last semester with her and she was great. She is very understanding and willing to help. Also great power points. The tests are not easy but the paper is. I highly recommend her.

Elena is very sweet! My problem with this class is just that her accent makes things hard to understand, and also makes the class boring because most of the time you're struggling to understand what she's saying. The class is based upon 3 tests. Her study guides aren't the best but tests were okay.

I took her class this semester intro to sociology. she is very nice and smart and willing to help. She gave us extra credit for each test.  has an accent but you get used to it. There are 3 tests and one paper. The tests are difficult but you can pass if you read the book. I recommend her and I will take her classes again.
She is funny and nice and willing to help. There are 3 tests and a paper. The paper is easy if you follow her instructions.  Prepare to read a lot for the tests.
Her class consist of 3 test and each test is worth 25% of your grade. READ the book If you choose to take her!! One test consist of about 5 chapters. READ, READ ,READ.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Caring

comment: She's cool. Take her class!  If you do the work it's not difficult to get an A.

she is very sweet and she wants her students succeed. Sometimes her lectures are long but I learned a lot form this class. She was my favorite professor this semester. You need to read the book. The tests are difficult but you can make an A if you study the book. And don't miss classes. She takes attendance every class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: She's a great teacher. She is from Romania so she has a slight accent but it's nothing that would stop anyone from understanding her. She gave a 5-7% curve on every exam so she absolutely wants her students to do well. Make study guides and get a study guide from her! She gave plenty of opportunities for extra credit.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Okay look Professor Gheorhiu is a great professor. She care about her students and shes open to hear what you have to say. You have 3 test. Im not going to lie they are hard but just read your book! OMG I cannot stress !! Read the book. Also make sure you study!! Study like crazy! And honestly do the study guides. Overall she's a good teacher .
rating_tags: Respected--Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Ms. Gheorghiu has an accent which makes class boring and hard to understand. All you have are 3 tests and a short essay. READ THE BOOK! It will be your best friend to pass the tests. The lectures are kinda pointless because the answers to the test come from the book. Not word for word but they're in there. Attendance is taken every day. DO NOT SKIP
rating_tags: Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: She has an accent, so if you sit in the back of the class it can be hard to understand. She gives study guides that are very helpful; however, she still has test questions on stuff not mentioned in study guide. So you are forced to literally know your terms for each chapter. She gives test after every 5 chapters. She is nice!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: She's super sweet, & she tries to make class interesting... but sometimes it gets boring. But she's very interested in class participation and discussion. Every day she lectures and takes attendance. There are three exams and one VERY short paper that's easy to write. If you show up, take notes & then study them before the test, you'll do fine.
